alert.note: Alert for Armstrong; Deaf Smith; Oldham; Palo Duro Canyon; Potter; Randall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 27 at 3:35AM CST until February 27 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE SOUTHWESTERN TO SOUTH-CENTRAL TEXAS PANHANDLE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR MUCH OF THE COMBINED OKLAHOMA AND TEXAS PANHANDLES... The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Red Flag Warning for strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from noon today to 8 PM CST this evening. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued. This Fire Weather Watch for strong winds and low relative humidity is in effect from Tuesday morning through Tuesday evening. * Affected Area...In Texas...Oldham...Potter...Deaf Smith... Randall...Armstrong and Palo Duro Canyon. * 20 Foot Winds...For today, West-southwest 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. For tomorrow, West 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * Relative Humidity...For today, As low as 9 percent. For tomorrow as low as 10 percent. * Red Flag Threat Index...For today, 2 to 3 with isolated 4. For tomorrow, 3 to 6. * Timing...Red Flag Warning today, noon to 8 PM. Fire Weather Watch tomorrow, 10 AM through 8 PM CST.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks. A Fire Weather Watch means that the potential for critical fire weather conditions exists. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
